intro: Galium bussei var. strictius, commonly known as the narrowleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers in the late spring and early summer. Its leaves are typically oval to lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy surface. Galium bussei var. strictius thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks.
